definition: surname Mi/name of an ancient state
Secret of the Magic Gourd (1958), prize-winning children's fairy tale by Zhang Tianyi 張天翼|张天翼[Zhang1 Tian1 yi4]
pinyin: Bao3 hu2 lu5 de5 Mi4 mi4

sentences.english: There aring a lot of secrets in the man heart can't say literally that let wife listen to.
sentences.chinese: 男人心中有好多秘密不能随便说给妻子听。

sentences.english: A dynamic and verifiable threshold color visual multi-secret sharing scheme was proposed.
sentences.chinese: 提出了动态可验证的彩色可视多重秘密共享方案。

sentences.english: It's such a mystery, but the NBA seems to be demystifying the whole idea.
sentences.chinese: 他是如此神秘，但是NBA似乎有了解开秘密的注意。

sentences.english: "Other than pedophilia, it's the most secretive behavior I've encountered, " says Charles Yesalis, a Penn State University professor who has studied steroid use for 28 years.
sentences.chinese: 除了恋童癖外，这是我遇到过最秘密的行为了。

sentences.english: For instance, some clandestine publications are beautifully produced. Well, where did the paper come from?
sentences.chinese: 举例说，有些秘密刊物印得那么漂亮，哪儿来的纸？

sentences.english: The cold stone of the mysterious obelisk guards its secrets.
sentences.chinese: 神秘方尖塔上的冰冷岩石保守着它的秘密。

sentences.english: A practitioner surnamed Zheng, from a county of Heilongjiang, still practices Falun Gong secretly.
sentences.chinese: 一名来自黑龙江某县姓郑的练习者仍然在秘密练功。

sentences.english: Russia accuses Georgia of secretly massing troops for an invasion of Abkhazia.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯指责格鲁吉亚秘密集结军队入侵阿布哈兹。

sentences.english: But there were more skeletons in the closet.
sentences.chinese: 但是其中还有更多不可告人的秘密。

sentences.english: What does your favorite mobile app know about you?
sentences.chinese: 你最心水的手机应用程序知道你的什么秘密？

sentences.english: THE CELESTINE PROPHECY contains secrets that are currently changing our world.
sentences.chinese: 圣境预言书包含秘密，目前正在改变我们的世界。

sentences.english: Do you want to solve "Arkham's biggest mystery"?
sentences.chinese: 你想要解答“阿克汉姆最大的秘密”吗？

sentences.english: Unless you're privy to divine inspiration, the best thing to do is to watch the process evolve.
sentences.chinese: 除非你知道秘密内情，最好的办法就是静观其变。

sentences.english: Publishers in Paris and New York had secretly received the manuscript on microfilm.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎和纽约的出版商秘密接收了收稿的影印胶卷。

sentences.english: Let's go burrowing in the brain. Let'slook at how lies get started.
sentences.chinese: 让我们继续挖掘大脑的秘密吧，看看谎言由何而起。

sentences.english: Prosecutors said none of the suspects got any real secrets.
sentences.chinese: 检察官称嫌疑人没有得到任何真正的秘密。

definition: the truth about sth/the actual facts
to hide/to conceal/to mask/to shelter/to harbor (i.e. keep sth hidden)/to hide oneself/to lie low/to nestle/hidden/implicit/private/covert/recessed (lighting)
to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
rarely known to anyone (idiom); almost unknown/secret to all but a few
precious mineral deposits/hidden treasure/(fig.) treasure/(Buddhism) the treasure of Buddha's law
to keep sth confidential/to maintain secrecy
lit. to guard one's mouth like a closed bottle (idiom); tight-lipped/reticent/not breathing a word
